description:
Webfestschrift Marshak 2003 Ērān ud Anērān: Studies presented to Boris Ilich Marshak on the Occasion of His 70th Birthday. Electronic Version.
Matteo Compareti, Paola Raffetta, Gianroberto Scarcia - Editors
October 2003
Transoxiana regrets the passing away of Boris Marshak (9 July 1933-28 July 2006) at the site of the archeological excavations of Ancient Panjikent.
.
  • (Paola Raffetta, USAL)
  • Compiler: V. Shkoda
  • On the history of the ancient town of Vardana and the Obavija Feud
  • Sixth Century Alania: Between Byzantium, Sasanian Iran and the Turkic World [PDF document]Abstract
  • On the Bugut Inscription and Mausoleum Complex
  • Bullae from the Pahlavi Archive at the University of California, Berkeley
  • Sogd under Turkish Rule during VIth-VIIIth centuries (On Sogdian and Turkish Symbiosis)
  • On the importance of the "Misimian's" - Kodori Route in the 1st-6th Centuries
  • The Yuezhi Migration and Sogdia
  • Bronze door-knockers of Cizre Great Mosque, A New Example
  • Colonization of the Black Sea by the Ancient Greeks and its Ecological Consequences
  • At the roots of the Sasanian royal imagery: The Persepolis Graffiti
  • The Role of the Sogdian Colonies in the Diffusion of the Pearl Roundels Pattern
  • "They called themselves Avar" - Considering the pseudo-Avar question in the work of Theophylaktos.
  • Volga Bulgaria Silver of the 10th-14th centuries (on materials of the Trans-Urals collections)

  • Agathias and the date of Zoroaster

  • Archeology of Funeral Rituals as revealed by Tibetan tombs of the 8th to 9th century
  • Bronze ewers of craftsman Ahmad
  • Chinese Pictorial Space at the Cultural Crossroads
  • Use and production of silks in Sogdiana
  • To the Question of Origin of the Name Hashimgird
  • Contribution to the Debates on the Origin of the Medieval Bosnian Royal Dynasty Kotromanids
  • Ancient Turk Rock Inscriptions in the Talass Ala-Too: A Sogdian Word in an Old Turk Inscription
  • . An Overview of the Sealings on the Bactrian Documents in the Khalili Collection [Abstract only]
  • Sogdians and Imitations of Byzantine Gold Coin Unearthed in the Heartland of China
  • Three New Ostraca Documents from Old Nisa
  • "Shapur's Will" in Bukhara
  • Heroic fights and dying heroes - The Orlat battle plaque and the roots of Sogdian art
  • A Note on Sogdian Coroplastics - Two Ossuary Fragments from Afrasiab
  • Christiano-Sogdica: An Updated Bibliography on the Relationship between Sogdians and Christianity throughout Central Asia and into China
  • Aspects of the relationship between the ancient Turkish and Sogdians -based on a stone statue with Sogdian inscription in Xinjiang-[Abstract]
  • Scythian genealogical legend in «Rustamiada»
  • . Sogdians around Ancient Tarim basin [Abstract only]
  • Coins from Kish. 3rd-2nd Century BC - 8th Century AD
  • . "Animal Style" Art and the Image of the Horse and Rider[Abstract]
  • On The Two Intertwined Dragons from Pendzikent
  • Dwelling houses of Bukhara in the Early Middle Ages
  • Once more about peculiarities of the Sogdian Civilization of the 4th-10th Centuries
  • The identification of the King of kings in the upper register of the Larger Grotto, Taq-i Bustan - Ardashir III restated
  • Apar in Turkish Inscriptions of VIIIth Century and Armenian Sources [PDF][Abstract]
  • The Sun God at Kizil
  • . Sogdien et Avesta. Essais de grammaire compare'e des langues iraniennes VIII[Abstract]
  • Hülägü's Campaign in the West (1256-1260)
  • The Late Sogdian Costume (the 5th - 8th cc. AD)
